title: Gravity field - rocket loses mass to go into orbit

content.question: A rocket of initial mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is on the surface of a planet of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>. The rocket is then launched into a circular orbit. When the rocket has reached its orbit, it is a distance <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math> above the planet’s surface and the rocket’s mass is <math alttext="the fraction lowercase m over 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>. What is the ratio of the gravitational field experienced by the rocket in orbit to the gravitational field on the surface of the planet?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
